newsitem.title: POLAND: TEXACO TO INVEST $500 MLN IN POLAND IN 10 YRS.
newsitem.headline: TEXACO TO INVEST $500 MLN IN POLAND IN 10 YRS.

text.p: The U.S. Texaco Inc. is planning to build up to 300 filling stations in Poland over the next 10 years at a total cost of up to $500 million, the head of Texaco's Polish unit said on Saturday.
"We plan to build 300 petrol stations in Poland by investing up to $500 million," Peter Oakford told reporters at the opening ceremony of Texaco's fifth petrol filling station in Poland.
Texaco, which so far invested $30 million in Poland, also wants to participate in the privatisation of Poland's state-owned oil firm Nafta Polska SA.
"Texaco is also declaring the will to actively participate in the privatisation of Polska Nafta," Oakford said.
Last Month Nafta Polska shortlisted five international consortia in a tender for an adviser in its sell-off.

The tender's winner, due to be chosen this month, would be responsible for financial, economic, legal and environmental studies necessary for the planned public offering of two refineries -- Petrochemia Plock SA and Rafineria Gdansk SA.
The adviser would prepare refineries' privatisation offers, which are to be sent to prospective investors early next year.
